ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Serous Otitis Media (Left Ear)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of URI, barotrauma, and 'pop' on flight, supported by mixed hearing loss and Type B tympanogram.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Eustachian Tube Dysfunction
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Precipitating event (flight), negative pressure in the right ear, and fluid accumulation in the left ear.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Barotrauma
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Sudden onset of otalgia, pressure, and hearing loss during an airplane flight.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To determine the degree, type, and configuration of hearing loss given the sudden onset.
To assess speech reception thresholds and word recognition abilities.
To evaluate middle ear function and detect presence of fluid or negative pressure.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The evaluation reveals a mixed hearing loss in the left ear with a flat tympanogram, consistent with serous otitis media following barotrauma. The right ear shows high-frequency sensorineural loss with a patent PE tube but excessive negative pressure.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: RE: Normal (250-2000 Hz) sloping to moderate loss (6-8 kHz). LE: Slight-to-moderate mixed loss (250-1000 Hz), rising to mild SNHL at 2000 Hz, sloping to moderate/severe mixed loss (3-8 kHz).

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: RE: SRT 17 dB, WRS 96%. LE: SRT 40 dB, WRS 96%.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: RE: Large ear canal volume (3.3 mL) with excessive negative pressure (-325 daPa). LE: Flat (Type B) with normal volume (1.6 mL).

proposed_items: Potential PE tube placement if effusion does not resolve
counseling_actions: Explanation of 'airplane ear' (barotrauma) and serous otitis media
Instruction on how to perform autoinsufflation exercises
Discussion of the treatment plan involving antibiotics and potential surgical intervention

escalation.rationale_short: Medical management is required for serous otitis media and barotrauma; patient is already under otologist care.

follow_up_plan.objective: Re-evaluate middle ear status and hearing thresholds to determine if PE tube placement is necessary.
